title: aircore
text: Now can last step generating receptor list files. Now filter selected columns can round altitude also Now can format time variables two digits column indicate AGL ASL Finally, save receptors
code: receptor <- master[, c("site_code",                        "year",                        "month",                        "day",                        "hour",                        "minute",                        "second",                        "latitude",                        "longitude",                        "altitude_final",                        "type_altitude")] receptor$altitude_final <- round(receptor$altitude_final) receptor <- obs_format(receptor,                         spf =  c("month", "day",                                  "hour", "minute", "second")) receptor_agl <- receptor[type_altitude == 0] receptor_asl <- receptor[type_altitude == 1] if(nrow(receptor_agl) > 0) {   message(paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_AGL.txt"), "\n")    fwrite(x = receptor_agl,          file = paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_AGL.txt"),          sep = " ") }  if(nrow(receptor_asl) > 0) {   message(paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_ASL.txt"), "\n")    fwrite(x = receptor_asl,          file = paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "receptor_ASL.txt"),          sep = " ")  } #> C:\Users\sibarrae\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpQ33K7x\file8b4862a53ca7_aircore_receptor_ASL.txt

title: aircore
text: Finally, just plot data, run locally
code: obs_plot(df3, time = "timeUTC", yfactor = 1e9) #> Found the following sites:  #> [1] AirCoreNOAA #> Plotting the following sites:  #> [1] AirCoreNOAA #> png  #>   2 library(sf) x <- st_as_sf(df3, coords = c("longitude", "latitude"), crs = 4326) plot(x["value"], axes = T, reset = F) maps::map(add = T) x <- df3 x$ch4 <- x$value*1e+9obs_plot(x,           time = "ch4",           y = "altitude_final",           colu = "month", n = c(1L, 3L, 6L, 8L, 9L, 11L, 12L),           type = "b",           xlab = expression(CH[4]~ppb),           ylab = "altitude (m)")

code: receptor <- master[, c("site_code",                        "year",                        "month",                        "day",                        "hour",                        "minute",                        "second",                        "latitude",                        "longitude",                        "altitude_final",                        "type_altitude")] receptor$altitude_final <- round(receptor$altitude_final) receptor <- obs_format(receptor,                         spf =  c("month", "day",                                  "hour", "minute", "second")) receptor_agl <- receptor[type_altitude == 0] receptor_asl <- receptor[type_altitude == 1] if(nrow(receptor_agl) > 0) {   message(paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_AGL.txt"), "\n")    fwrite(x = receptor_agl,          file = paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_AGL.txt"),          sep = " ") }  if(nrow(receptor_asl) > 0) {   message(paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_ASL.txt"), "\n")    fwrite(x = receptor_asl,          file = paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "receptor_ASL.txt"),          sep = " ")  } #> C:\Users\sibarrae\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpCmgiyH\file7abc7b936bd2_aircraft-insitu_receptor_ASL.txt

title: shipboard-flask
text: Now can last step generating receptor list files. Now filter selected columns can round altitude also Now can format time variables two digits column indicate AGL ASL Finally, save receptors
code: receptor <- master[, c("site_code",                      "year",                      "month",                      "day",                      "hour",                      "minute",                      "second",                      "latitude",                      "longitude",                      "altitude_final",                      "type_altitude",                      "time_decimal")] receptor$altitude_final <- round(receptor$altitude_final) receptor <- obs_format(receptor,                         spf =  c("month", "day",                                  "hour", "minute", "second")) receptor_agl <- receptor[type_altitude == 0] receptor_asl <- receptor[type_altitude == 1] if(nrow(receptor_agl) > 0) {   message(paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_AGL.txt"), "\n")    fwrite(x = receptor_agl,          file = paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_AGL.txt"),          sep = " ") }  if(nrow(receptor_asl) > 0) {   message(paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_ASL.txt"), "\n")    fwrite(x = receptor_asl,          file = paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "receptor_ASL.txt"),          sep = " ")  }

text: need start time columns. function obs_addtime adds time columns timeUTC, timeUTC_start shows start time observation timeUTC_end shows end time observation. need key_time aggregate data. can done using UTC, solar, local time. normal approach using afternoon solar local time.

title: surface-insitu
text: Solar time Local time columns site_utc2lst Local time longitude solar time (default) select hours interest aggregate data year, month day solar time. way, one information per day. however approach appropriate aircraft aggregated every 10 20 seconds. Hence need aggregate data one time column. Also, helps generate receptor info files including hour, minute second. Hence, need add solar local time column. local time column site_utc2lst need identify local time function add_ltime. important identifying observations evening local time. add_ltime uses two methods, first identify time difference utc identifying metadata column site_utc2lst. solar time available #now need cut solar time frequency needed. work local time longitude information available, aircrafts instance, local time calculated approximation based longitude: lt=UTC+longitude/15*60*60 lt = UTC + longitude/15 * 60 * 60  ltlt local time, UTCUTC time, longitudelongitude coordinate. , time cut every two hours. Now, identify local time select evening hours.
code: df2$solar_time <- obs_addstime(df2)

title: surface-insitu
text: Now key column time, can cut accordingly. can check solar time cut solar time. Please note solar_time_cut, column used aggregate data filter required solar time, case 14. point can calculate averages several columns cut time. function obs_agg aggregation shown following lines code. argument gby establish function used aggregate cols. need aggregate data date (year, month, date), already filtered hours interest. , 1 observation per day. standard, let us define key_time solar_time. obs_agg function aggregate desired data column. add column max_altitude identify max altitude site.

title: surface-insitu
text: Now can last step generating receptor list files. Now filter selected columns can round altitude also Now can format time variables two digits column indicate AGL ASL Finally, save receptors
code: receptor <- master[, c("site_code",                      "year",                      "month",                      "day",                      "hour",                      "minute",                      "second",                      "latitude",                      "longitude",                      "altitude_final",                      "type_altitude",                      "time_decimal")] receptor$altitude_final <- round(receptor$altitude_final) receptor <- obs_format(receptor,                         spf =  c("month", "day",                                  "hour", "minute", "second")) receptor_agl <- receptor[type_altitude == 0] receptor_asl <- receptor[type_altitude == 1] if(nrow(receptor_agl) > 0) {   message(paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_AGL.txt"), "\n")    fwrite(x = receptor_agl,          file = paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_AGL.txt"),          sep = " ") }  if(nrow(receptor_asl) > 0) {   message(paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "_receptor_ASL.txt"), "\n")    fwrite(x = receptor_asl,          file = paste0(out, "_", datasetid, "receptor_ASL.txt"),          sep = " ")  } #> C:\Users\sibarrae\AppData\Local\Temp\Rtmp4k67qL\file531463a43a74_surface-insitu_receptor_AGL.txt

title: obs_hysplit_control  obs_hysplit_control
text: df data.frame receptor information. Must include, "year", "month", "day", "hour" (0:23), "minute", "latitude", "longitude", "altitude" year year, missing df. month month, missing df. day day, missing df. hour hour, missing df. minute minute, missing df. lat latitude, missing df. lon longitude, missing df. alt altitude, missing df. nlocations number locations. duration number hours release. (Negative backwards time). vertical_motion Vertical motion option.  (0:data 1:isob 2:isen 3:dens 4:sigma 5:diverg 6:msl2agl 7:average 8:damped). . default "data" selection use meteorological model's vertical velocity fields; options include isobaric, isentropic, constant density, constant internal sigma coordinate, computed velocity divergence, special transformation correct vertical velocities mapped quasi-horizontal surfaces (relative  MSL) HYSPLIT's internal terrain following sigma coordinate,  special option (7) spatially average vertical velocity.  averaging distance automatically computed ratio  temporal frequency data horizontal grid resolution.  Default 5 top_model_domain altitude ground level (m). met meteorological models used. nmet Number days meteorological files. Default number days duration plus two days. nmet number simultaneous input meteorological files. instance, 11 means meteorological grid, 11 files expected. Usually, files daily. Note number files required grid approach. Hysplit expects something like 2 11, means 2 meteorological grids 11 files . number 2 comes length met files. metpath paths meteorological model output. metformat format applied meteorological daily file ngases Default 1. gas default "Foot". emissions_rate Default 0 hour_emissions hour release, depend type release, instantaneous 0.01, continuous 1. release_start derived df. nsim_grids Number simulated grids. center_conc_grids center coordinates conc grid. grid_spacing grid spacing, default 0.1 degree. grid_span model extension degrees dimension. nconc name concentration file, default "cdump" nvert_levels number vertical levels height_vert_levels hright vertical levels (50) sampling_start_time 2 digits year, month, day, hour, minute sampling_end_time 2 digits year, month, day, hour, minute sampling_interval_type type, hour, minure npol_depositing number pollutant depositing particle_params Particle diameter, density, shape dmwsrdre DepVel, MW, SurfReRa, DifRa, EHenry wrhcicbc Wet removal: HC, incloud, belowcloud radiactive_decay days pol_res Pollutant Resuspension (1/m) control name file, default "CONTROL"

code: obs_hysplit_setup(   idsp = 2,   capemin = 500,   vscales = -1,   kbls = 1,   kblt = 5,   kmixd = 0,   initd = 0,   veght = 0.5,   kmix0 = 150,   numpar = 500,   maxpar = 500,   ichem = 8,   krand = 4,   varsiwant = c("time", "indx", "lati", "long", "zagl", "zsfc", "foot", "samt", "temp",     "dswf", "mlht", "dens", "dmas", "sigw", "tlgr"),   ivmax = length(varsiwant),   outdt = 15,   extra_params,   bypass_params,   setup = "SETUP.CFG" )

title: obs_hysplit_setup  obs_hysplit_setup
text: idsp particle dispersion scheme 1:HYSPLIT 2:STILT capemin -1 convection; -2 Grell convection scheme; -3 extreme convection; >0 enhanced vertical mixing CAPE exceeds value (J/kg) vscales vertical Lagrangian time scale (sec) stable PBL kbls boundary layer stability derived 1:fluxes 2:wind_temperature kblt boundary layer turbulence parameterizations 1:Beljaars 2:Kanthar 3:TKE 4:Measured 5:Hanna kmixd mixed layer obtained 0:input 1:temperature 2:TKE 3:modified Richardson initd initial distribution, particle, puff, combination veght Height particle's time spent tallied calculate footprint PARTICLE_STILT.DAT less equal 1. 0: fraction PBL height; greater 1.0: heightAGL (m) kmix0 minimum mixing depth numpar number puffs particles released per cycle maxpar maximum number particles carried simulation ichem chemistry conversion modules 0:none 1:matrix 2:convert 3:dust 4: conc grid equal met grid, 5: divide output mass air density (kg/m3) sum mixing ration, 7: transport deposited particles ocean surface, 8: stilt mode mixing ratio varying layer, 9: set concentration layer one fraction boundary layer, 10: restructure concentration grid time-varying transfer matrix, 11: enable daughter produyct calculation. krand 0 method calculate random number 0=precompute NUMPAR greater 5000 dynamic NUMPAR less equal 5000; 1=precalculated; 2=calculated pardsp; 3=none; 4=random initial seed number calculated pardsp; 10=0 random initial seed non-dispersion applications; 11=1 random initial seed non-dispersion applications; 12=2 random initial seed non-dispersion applications; 13=3 random initial seed non-dispersion applications varsiwant ='TIME','INDX','LONG','LATI','ZAGL','SIGW','TLGR','ZSFC', TEMP', 'SAMT','FOOT','SHTF','DMAS','DENS','RHFR','SPHU','DSWF','WOUT','MLHT','PRES' variables written PARTICLE_STILT.DAT. However, default case : c('time','indx', 'lati','long','zagl', 'zsfc','foot','samt', 'temp', 'dswf','mlht','dens','dmas','sigw','tlgr' ivmax 0 number variables written PARTICLE_STILT.DAT. Must equal number variables listed variable VARSIWANT outdt Default 15. defines output frequency minutes endpoint positions PARTICLE.DAT file STILT emulation mode configured. default value 0 results output time step positive value gives output frequency minutes. negative value disables output. output frequency even multiple time step evenly divisible 60. STILT emulation mode, time step forced one minute. extra_params parameters bypass_params named vector characters bypass arguments. list available, content list used write SETUP.CFG file arguments. setup Default SETUP.CFG

title: obs_hysplit_setup  obs_hysplit_setup
text: var description comes hysplit 5.3 manual page 214  hysplit user guide: STILT mode STILT model incorporates variation HYSPLIT developed Lin et al. (2003 - JGR, VOL. 108, . D16, 4493, doi:10.1029/2002JD003161) can used estimate upwind surface fluxes atmospheric measurements. Two changes introduced; mass summation divided air density resulting mixing ratio output field (ICHEM=6) lowest concentration summation layer (concentration layer top depth) permitted vary mixed layer depth (ICHEM=9). ICHEM=8 switch turns density varying layer depth. Two text files particle position  information (PARTICLE.DAT PARTICLE_STILT.DAT) time step  also created unless namelist parameter OUTDT defining output  interval (min) changed. title: Read obspack (.txt)  obs_read
text: identification altitude type critical. approach used consists : 1. Identify agl name tile. 2. magl present, search dill_values used elevation transform NA (available) 3. magl present, agl = altitude - elevation 4. NA elevation, result NA agl 5. new column added named `altitude_final` store agl asl 6. Another column named `type_altitude` added identify "magl" "masl" 7. case NA `altitude_final`, `type_altitude` "available" , relationship hysplit :
